SENT.plain: We report a case of thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP) in a 47-year-old woman, who presented fluctuating visual disturbances which had developed over the last six months
An antiphospholipid syndrome was suspected and intravenous heparin treatment was started
One week later, hemolytic anemia and renal insufficiency occurred
Severe deficiency of von Willebrand factor-cleaving protease was found and a diagnostic of TTP was made
The clinical outcome was favorable after treatment with plasmapheresis and fresh frozen plasma
Diagnosis, etiology and treatment of this life-threatening disease are discussed
